summary_markdown:
# About SeekOut

SeekOut is a talent intelligence platform founded on August 1, 2016, and is headquartered in Redmond, Washington. The company was co-founded by Anoop Gupta, Vikas Manocha, John Tippett, and Aravind Bala. As of December 2023, SeekOut employs 191 people, a reduction from previous years, which may indicate restructuring or market adjustments [(Tracxn, 2021-08-17)](https://tracxn.com/d/companies/seekout/__i3sDeHa60YW_vCWOVbkli4cYFfYw_SwnS8SNT1DP8Iw). The company operates in the B2B SaaS sector, focusing on high-tech markets, and has raised a total of $186 million in funding across several rounds, with its latest Series C round in January 2022 valuing the company at $1.2 billion [(Tracxn, 2021-08-17)](https://tracxn.com/d/companies/seekout/__i3sDeHa60YW_vCWOVbkli4cYFfYw_SwnS8SNT1DP8Iw).

SeekOut's products and services are designed to enhance talent acquisition and management processes. The company offers several key products:

- **SeekOut Recruit**: A software solution for talent acquisition that helps teams find candidates through various channels.
- **SeekOut Grow**: A talent management tool that includes features like an internal talent marketplace and career pathing.
- **SeekOut Spot**: An AI-driven recruiting service that combines AI agents with human recruiters to streamline hiring.
- **SeekOut Assist**: A tool that uses AI to generate targeted searches and personalized messages for candidates.

SeekOut serves over 700 customers across various sectors, including technology, defense, and pharmaceuticals. The platform is particularly noted for its effectiveness in sourcing diverse candidates [(Tracxn, 2021-08-17)](https://tracxn.com/d/companies/seekout/__i3sDeHa60YW_vCWOVbkli4cYFfYw_SwnS8SNT1DP8Iw). The company distributes its products through partnerships with various talent acquisition platforms, such as iCIMS, Greenhouse, and Workday, among others [(SeekOut, 2024-07-16)](https://www.seekout.com/blog/introduction-talent-intelligence).

# Key Personnel

- **Anoop Gupta**: Co-founder and CEO of SeekOut. Gupta has a background in computer science and entrepreneurship, having previously worked at Microsoft and Stanford University. He emphasizes the importance of adapting to market changes and leveraging AI to enhance recruitment processes [(Garnick, Madrona, 2025-04-24)](https://www.madrona.com/rise-of-agentic-ai-in-recruiting-seekout-anoop-gupta/).

# News

## Layoffs and Restructuring

In May 2024, SeekOut laid off 30% of its workforce, a move that was part of a broader trend of layoffs in the tech industry. This reduction in workforce may reflect internal challenges or market adjustments [(TechCrunch, 2024-05-26)](https://techcrunch.com/2024/05/20/seekout-layoffs-30percent-talent-search-tigerglobal/). The layoffs were reported by multiple sources, including GeekWire and The Business Journals [(GeekWire, 2024-05-26)](https://www.geekwire.com/2024/recruiting-software-company-seekout-lays-off-employees-in-another-round-of-cuts/) [(The Business Journals, 2024-05-26)](https://www.bizjournals.com/seattle/news/2024/05/21/seekout-layoffs-recruiting-tech.html).

## Product Innovations

SeekOut has introduced several innovations, including SeekOut Spot, which uses agentic AI to significantly reduce the time from job description to qualified candidates, reportedly from 45 days to just three. This innovation allows recruiters to focus on strategic tasks while the AI handles labor-intensive aspects of candidate sourcing [(Garnick, Madrona, 2025-04-24)](https://www.madrona.com/rise-of-agentic-ai-in-recruiting-seekout-anoop-gupta/).

## Funding and Valuation

SeekOut has raised a total of $186 million in funding, with its most recent Series C round in January 2022 raising $115 million and valuing the company at $1.2 billion [(Tracxn, 2021-08-17)](https://tracxn.com/d/companies/seekout/__i3sDeHa60YW_vCWOVbkli4cYFfYw_SwnS8SNT1DP8Iw).

## Market Position

SeekOut is a key player in the talent intelligence market, competing with 33 active competitors, including Bryq and Cangrade. The company's innovative use of AI helps maintain its strong market position [(Tracxn, 2021-08-17)](https://tracxn.com/d/companies/seekout/__i3sDeHa60YW_vCWOVbkli4cYFfYw_SwnS8SNT1DP8Iw).

## Employee and Customer Sentiment

SeekOut is recognized for its commitment to diversity and employee satisfaction, promoting a culture of kindness, gratitude, and curiosity. However, the recent reduction in employee count may raise questions about internal challenges or market adjustments [(SeekOut, 2024-12-18)](https://www.seekout.com/blog/strategic-interview-questions-to-ask-candidates).

# Conclusion

SeekOut is positioned as a leader in the AI-driven recruitment space, with a strong focus on talent intelligence and innovative solutions like SeekOut Spot. The company's significant funding and valuation reflect its potential for growth and impact in the recruitment industry. As it continues to evolve, SeekOut's commitment to leveraging AI for better hiring practices and employee management will be crucial for its future success.

# SeekOut Company Overview

## Company History
SeekOut is a talent intelligence platform designed to enhance talent acquisition and management processes. The company focuses on providing innovative solutions that help organizations discover and engage with both internal and external candidates.

## Services and Products
SeekOut offers a range of services and products aimed at improving talent acquisition and management:

- **SeekOut Recruit**: A talent acquisition software that assists teams in finding the best candidates through various channels, including outbound sourcing and inbound candidates.
  
- **SeekOut Grow**: A talent management software that helps organizations manage their internal talent effectively. It includes features like an internal talent marketplace, career pathing, learning paths for upskilling, and mentorship opportunities.

- **SeekOut Spot**: An end-to-end recruiting service that combines AI agents with human recruiters to streamline the hiring process.

- **SeekOut Assist**: A tool that uses AI to generate targeted searches and personalized messages for candidates based on job descriptions.

## Customers
SeekOut serves a diverse clientele, including organizations looking to enhance their talent acquisition strategies and improve workforce diversity. The platform is particularly noted for its effectiveness in sourcing diverse candidates.

## Leadership Team
SeekOut promotes a culture of collaboration, empathy, and continuous learning among its leadership and employees. The company values open communication and encourages team members to share ideas and adapt to new challenges.

## Company Culture
SeekOut fosters a supportive and innovative work environment characterized by:

- **Collaboration**: Team members work across functions to help each other grow and develop skills.
  
- **Empathy**: The company emphasizes kindness and understanding in its interactions, both internally and externally.

- **Continuous Learning**: Employees are encouraged to keep an open mind and adapt to new ideas and technologies.

## Technology and Innovation
SeekOut leverages advanced technologies, including AI and machine learning, to enhance its services. The platform provides comprehensive data analytics and powerful search capabilities to help organizations make informed hiring decisions.

## Partnerships
SeekOut collaborates with various partners in the talent acquisition space, including:

- iCIMS
- Greenhouse
- Avature
- Beamery
- Lever
- Bullhorn
- SmartRecruiters
- Phenom
- Workday
- SAP SuccessFactors
- Jobvite
- GR8 People
- Crelate
- Loxo
- Invenias
- Ashby

These partnerships enhance SeekOut's offerings and provide customers with integrated solutions for their hiring needs.

## Conclusion
SeekOut is a leading talent intelligence platform that combines innovative technology with a strong commitment to customer service and employee well-being. Its focus on diversity, collaboration, and continuous improvement positions it as a valuable partner for organizations looking to enhance their talent acquisition and management strategies. 

For more information, visit [SeekOut](https://www.seekout.com/).

# [Privacy Policy: Your Data is Secure with SeekOut](https://www.seekout.com/privacy)
The SeekOut services include an online talent search and talent optimization solution that allows customers to (i) discover and engage with internal and external candidates; and (ii) analyze attributes of existing personnel for internal talent purposes, including through the compilation and maintenance of the SeekOut Candidate Database. The SeekOut services also include performing candidate sourcing and recruiting services for prospective employers. SeekOut is committed to data privacy and protection as a core value and governing principle for our company.

This Privacy Policy explains how ZipStorm, Inc. d/b/a SeekOut (“SeekOut”, “we”, “our”, or “us”) collects, uses, and shares personal information in order to create, maintain, and update the SeekOut Candidate Database and provide sourcing and recruiting services, and how you can exercise your privacy rights with respect to the personal information we collect. In addition to the SeekOut Candidate Database and sourcing and recruiting services, this Privacy Policy applies to information we collect when you visit our websites, including www.seekout.com, applications, and online services provided by us in connection with SeekOut; apply for a job with us; or when you otherwise interact with us (collectively, the “Services”). This Privacy Policy does not apply to data we process as a service provider on behalf of our customers. For information about the privacy practices of our customers or to exercise your rights with respect to such data, please consult their privacy policies.

In this Privacy Policy, “personal information” means information that identifies, relates to, describes, is reasonably capable of being associated with, or could reasonably be linked, directly or indirectly, with a particular individual. For the purposes of European data protection law, SeekOut is the data controller of your personal information as described in this Privacy Policy.

1. Personal Information We Collect

The personal information we collect depends on how you interact with our Services.

Information You Provide to Us

If you use of our Services, you may be asked to voluntarily provide personal information when you:

access or use our Services, including a demo/trial;

make a request to receive information about our Services;

contact our sales team or customer support team; or

attend one of our marketing events or webinars.

The personal information we collect may include your first and last name, job title, company name, email address, phone number, account password, search terms (including keywords and filter values), and any personal information contained in customer support requests.

Information Collected Automatically

If you use our Services we may automatically collect personal information from your device, including:

Log Information:

Including browser type and settings, access times, pages viewed, your IP address, and the page you visited before navigating to our websites.

Device Information:

Including the hardware model, operating system and version, unique device identifiers, and mobile network information related to your computer or mobile device.

Location Information:

Approximate location derived from your IP address.

Usage Information:

Including the content you view, features you use, the frequency and duration of your activities.

Cookies and Other Tracking Technologies: SeekOut and our service providers may collect personal information about your browser and device using various technologies, such as cookies and web beacons. We use cookies (small data files stored on your hard drive or in device memory) to count visits and traffic sources, see which areas and features of our Services are popular, and customize your browsing experience. We use web beacons (electronic images or pixels) to help deliver cookies, count visits, understand website usage, and measure marketing campaign effectiveness. You may disable the use of such cookies at any time by using your browser settings.

SeekOut maintains the SeekOut Candidate Database, which is primarily comprised of publicly available vocational information about a job candidate’s employment history, qualifications, and education. SeekOut licenses this publicly available information about job candidates from third-party data providers and stores that information in the SeekOut Candidate Database. If you have a professional profile on a publicly available website, we may license that information from our third-party data providers. Our third-party data providers may also collect information you have provided publicly on vocational websites, and our third-party data providers may also provide us with your contact information. The personal information we license may include your name, contact information, education, professional qualifications, work history, work title, and experience. We do not collect information such as job references or appraisal details. We also do not collect sensitive data (e.g., health, political affiliation) from any of these sites. We regularly update this information to ensure accuracy.

We use machine learning-powered functionality to infer other likely characteristics about job candidates in the SeekOut Candidate Database (e.g., our product uses binary machine learning classifiers to predict the likelihood of someone moving to a new role based on years at a company, years in a role, etc.) so that recruiters and hiring managers can be more targeted when approaching candidates. We also use this machine learning-powered functionality to make an inference of the demographic status of a candidate, including gender, race, ethnicity, and/or country of origin, using attributes extracted from candidate profiles (e.g., from first and last names, the country where they attended university, service in the armed forces, etc.). These inferences help recruiters easily find highly qualified and diverse candidates.

We use inferences to enable certain optional search filters within the SeekOut Candidate Database and candidate pipeline insights. Recruiters may elect to use these optional search filters and insights while searching within the SeekOut Candidate Database to find highly qualified and diverse candidates. Inferences are not stored on a candidate’s profile within the SeekOut Candidate Database, and inferences are not available for export outside of the SeekOut Candidate Database. Inferences about race or ethnic origin could be interpreted as sensitive personal information under some privacy laws. We voluntarily provide you with the ability to opt out of the use of this personal information, as outlined in the “Your Rights and Choices” section of this Privacy Policy.

Prospective employers may engage us to source and recruit qualified candidates for open job opportunities. We refer to these services as “SeekOut Spot.” To provide the SeekOut Spot services, we collect data about potential job candidates from the SeekOut Candidate Database, information licensed from other companies, and interactions between candidates and our recruiters. This data includes name, contact information, education, professional qualifications, work history, work title, and experience, as well as inferred information.

SeekOut Job Applicants

If you apply to work for SeekOut, attend a recruitment event, or otherwise participate in the SeekOut recruitment process, we may collect and process personal information about you. The personal information we collect may include your name, email address, phone number, home address, employment history, education, qualifications, and any other information provided in your application materials. We may also collect information about you from third-party sources, such as recruitment agencies, referrals, references, or background checks.

As part of your application, you may provide information relating to your gender, race, ethnic origin, physical or mental health, or criminal records.

If your application is unsuccessful, SeekOut may still retain and use the personal information you provide to us for a reasonable period of time to handle issues that may arise in connection with your application, to contact you regarding other employment opportunities, and for SeekOut's legitimate business purposes.

Information Collected About Children

We do not knowingly collect any personal information directly from children under the age of 18. If we discover we have received any personal information from a child under the age of 18, we will take reasonable steps to delete that information as quickly as possible. If you find information on SeekOut about anyone under the age of 16, please contact us at privacy@seekout.com.

2. Use of Personal Information

We use your personal information for the following purposes, as well as for other purposes set forth in this Privacy Policy.

User of Services or Website Visitor

If you are a user of our Services we use your personal information for the following purposes:

Business Purposes:

We may use your personal information to provide services to you, manage our business operations, comply with legal and financial obligations, and administer our customer relationships; for accounting and tax purposes; and to send technical notices, updates, security alerts, confirmations, invoices, and other support and administrative messages.

Maintenance and Improvement:

We may use your personal information to personalize and improve the Services to provide content or features that match your profile or interests; or to provide customer service and answer your inquiries, comments, and feedback.

Analytical:

We may use your personal information related to your browser and usage to monitor and analyze trends, usage, and activities in connection with our Services.

Security and Fraud Prevention:

We may use your personal information to detect, investigate, and prevent fraudulent transactions and other illegal activities and protect the rights and property of SeekOut and others.

Marketing and Promotion:

We may use your personal information to develop new products and Services; and communicate with you about products, services, offers, promotions, rewards, and information we think will be of interest to you.

SeekOut processes personal information relating to job candidates in the SeekOut Candidate Database to provide an effective recruitment solution for our customers. All job candidate information in our SeekOut Candidate Database is used by our customers to better source and match internal and external candidates with appropriate job opportunities. Customers’ use of the SeekOut Candidate Database is subject to the SeekOut Use Policy (available at www.seekout.com/terms/use-policy).

SeekOut Spot uses personal information relating to candidates to provide sourcing and recruiting services, including to:

Identify job candidates for open roles with prospective employers;

Match candidate qualifications with job requirements; and provide recommendations and profiles of job candidates to prospective employers.

Use of Job Applicant Information

We use the personal information we collect from job applicants to evaluate their qualifications for employment and to communicate with them about the hiring process. We may also use this information to comply with applicable legal requirements or to exercise or defend legal claims.

3. Targeted Advertising and Analytics

If you are a website visitor, this section applies to you. We engage others to provide analytics services, serve advertisements, and perform related services across the web and in mobile apps. These entities may use cookies, web beacons, SDKs, device identifiers and other technologies to collect information about your use of the Services and other websites and applications, including your IP address and other identifiers, web browser and mobile network information, pages viewed, time spent on pages or in apps, links clicked, and conversion information. This information is used to deliver advertising targeted to your interests on other companies’ sites or mobile apps and to analyze and track data including to understand how our ads perform and determine the popularity of certain content, and better understand your online activity.

Some of the activities described in this section may constitute “targeted advertising,” “sharing,” or “selling” under certain state privacy laws. See “Additional Information for Individuals in Certain U.S. States” for more information and the privacy rights available to residents of California, Colorado, Connecticut, Virginia, and Utah.

4. Disclosures of Personal Information

The personal information we collect about you will only be disclosed as described below and pursuant to this Privacy Policy.

Business Customers and End Users

If you are a business customer or end user of our services, we may disclose your information with the following categories of third parties:

Service Providers: We may share your personal information with our third-party service providers that work on behalf of SeekOut to provide Services. For example, we use technology vendors to host our platform, manage our website, and support our marketing activities. Certain optional functionality in the SeekOut platform uses Google Workspace APIs. We do not use Google Workspace APIs to develop, improve, or train generalized/non-personalized AI or machine learning models.

Merger, Sale, or Asset Transfer: We may disclose your personal information in connection with, or during negotiations of, any merger, sale of SeekOut assets, financing, or acquisition of all or a portion of our business by another company.

Affiliates and Subsidiaries: We may disclose your personal information between and among SeekOut and our current and future parents, affiliates, subsidiaries, and other companies under common control and ownership.

Compliance with Laws and Law Enforcement: We may disclose your personal information in response to a request for information from a competent law enforcement body, regulator, government agency, court, or third party if we believe the disclosure is in accordance with or required by: (i) any applicable law, regulation, or legal process; (ii) to exercise, establish, or defend our legal rights; or (iii) to protect your vital interests or those of any other person. We may also disclose your personal information if we believe your actions are inconsistent with our user agreements or policies, or to protect the rights, property, and safety of SeekOut or others.

Aggregated Data: We may also disclose aggregated or de-identified personal information that cannot reasonably be used to identify you. We will not attempt to re-identify such information except as permitted by law.

We disclose personal information (name, email address, phone number, education, professional qualifications, work history, etc.) about job candidates in the SeekOut Candidate Database with our business customers and users to provide an effective recruitment solution and to enable our customers’ recruiting professionals to better source and match candidates with appropriate job opportunities.

We may also disclose your personal information for any other purpose with your consent or at your direction.

If we identify you as a potential match for a job opportunity with a prospective employer, we may share your information with that employer.

Job Applicants

We may disclose personal information we collect from job applicants to third-party service providers that work on behalf of SeekOut to support our recruitment activities. We also use service providers to assist us in the hiring process such as background check providers.

5. International Data Transfers

In providing our Services to certain customers, we transfer data from international jurisdictions (including European Economic Area (EEA) countries) to the United States. As a result, your personal information may be transferred to and processed in countries other than the country in which you are resident. These countries may have data protection laws that are different than the laws of your country. We implement appropriate safeguards to protect your personal information in accordance with applicable law.

We are committed to transferring personal information in accordance with applicable law. In addition to the organizational and technical safeguards, we comply with our obligations under data processing agreements with our customers, including applicable standard contractual clauses (SCCs).

6. Data Retention

We retain your personal information for as long as reasonably necessary for the purposes described in this Privacy Policy, while we have a legitimate business need to do so (e.g., to provide you with a service you have requested), or as required by law (e.g., for tax, legal, accounting, or other purposes), whichever is longer.

When we have no ongoing legitimate business need to process your personal information, we will delete it or if this is not possible (for example, because your personal information has been stored in backup archives), then we will securely store your personal information and isolate it from any further processing until deletion is possible. In some circumstances, we may anonymize your personal information so that it can no longer be associated with you, in which case it is no longer personal information.

We refresh and update the personal information in the SeekOut Candidate Database on a regular basis (the frequency will vary but in certain instances, refreshing occurs as frequently as on a daily basis).

7. Third Party Websites, Services, and Applications

The Services may include links to third-party websites, services, and applications that are not owned or operated by SeekOut. This Privacy Policy does not apply to those websites, services, or applications, which may have their own privacy policies or notices that you should review to understand how they may collect, use, or disclose your personal information. SeekOut is not responsible for the content or privacy practices of any linked websites, services, or applications that are operated by third parties.

8. Your Rights and Choices

Account Information

If you have an account with us, you may update your account information by logging into your online account. To delete your account, contact us at privacy@seekout.com. We may retain certain information as required by law or for legitimate business purposes. We may also retain cached or archived copies of information about you for up to two (2) months.

Promotional Communications

You may opt out of receiving promotional messages from us by following the instructions in those messages. If you opt out, we may still send you non-promotional communications, such as those about your account or our ongoing business relationship.

Cookies and Similar Tracking Technologies

SeekOut uses cookies and similar tracking technologies to analyze visits to our websites and interactions with our communications to help us improve our website, services, and marketing campaigns. Most web browsers are set to accept cookies by default. If you prefer, you can usually adjust your browser settings to remove or reject browser cookies. Please note that removing or rejecting cookies could affect the availability and functionality of our Services.

Privacy Rights

Depending on where you reside, you may have the following privacy rights related to the personal information that we collect:

Right to Know: You may request that we disclose what personal information we have collected, used, disclosed, sold, or shared about you, and how it is used and disclosed;

Right to Data Portability: You are entitled to receive your personal information in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format, and you have the right to transfer this information to another data controller;

Right to Delete: You can request that we delete the personal information we have collected from you (with some exceptions) and request that our service providers do the same;

Non-Discrimination: You have the right not to receive discriminatory treatment for the exercise of your privacy rights under applicable law;

Right to Correct: You can request we correct the inaccurate personal information that we have about you;

Right to Restrict Processing: You can request that we restrict the processing of your personal information;

Right to Object: You can object to the processing of your personal information on certain grounds; and

Right to opt-out of sale/sharing/targeted advertising: You can opt-out of the “sale,” “share,” or use of your personal information for targeted advertising.

If you live in California, you also have the right to limit use and disclosure of sensitive personal information for specific purposes, such as providing you with the Services you have requested.

If you wish to exercise any of these privacy rights, please submit a request via the Privacy Choices Portal or via email at privacy@seekout.com. You may also exercise your right to opt out of sales, sharing, or targeted advertising by visiting our Services with a legally recognized opt-out preference signal enabled, such as the Global Privacy Control.

In order to protect your personal information from unauthorized access or deletion, we may require you to verify your identity before we can process a privacy request related to your personal information. If we cannot verify your identity, we may be unable to comply with your request to provide, correct, or delete your personal information.

9. Additional Information for Individuals in Certain U.S. States

This section provides additional information for residents of California, Colorado, Connecticut, Utah, and Virginia relating to their privacy rights under the consumer privacy laws enacted in those states that grant their residents certain rights and require additional disclosures (“State Laws”). If you are a resident of one of these states, this section applies to you.

This Privacy Policy describes the categories of personal information we have collected, disclosed for a business purpose, or sold over the preceding twelve (12) months. Please refer to the “Personal Information We Collect”, “Use of Personal Information”, and “Disclosures of Personal Information” sections above to see specifically what personal information is collected about you and how and to whom we disclose that personal information.

As required by certain State Laws, below we use tables to explain this same information, including the categories of personal information we collect (and have collected over the preceding twelve (12) months), types of entities to which we disclose such information, and the ways we use each category of information.

For Users of Our Services and Job Applicants

Collection, Use, and Disclosure of Personal Information for Business Purposes

Disclosure of Personal Information of SeekOut Job Applicants for Commercial Purposes

We do not disclose personal information of SeekOut Job Applicants for commercial purposes.

Disclosure of Personal Information of Users of our Services for Commercial Purposes

We may disclose the personal information of our customers and prospective customers to third parties for targeted advertising of our Services, such as to expand the reach and effectiveness of our marketing campaigns. Such disclosures are further reflected below:

These disclosures may be deemed as a “sale,” “share,” or “targeted advertising” under certain privacy laws. You may opt out of these disclosures by following the instructions below.

Collection, Use, and Disclosure of Personal Information for Business Purposes

Disclosure of Personal Information for Commercial Purposes

SeekOut works by providing professional information to employers and potential employers. Such disclosures are further reflected below. We do not disclose personal information from the SeekOut Candidate Database to third parties for purposes of targeted advertising.:

Sensitive and Demographic Personal Information

SeekOut makes certain inferences about individuals, including about their racial and ethnic origin, and stores that information in the SeekOut Candidate Database as disclosed in the “Personal Information We Collect” section. This information may be considered “sensitive information” under certain privacy laws, but relates to individuals solely in their professional capacity rather than their consumer or household capacity and is used solely to help recruiters to widen their potential recruitment pools to include historically underrepresented groups.

If you are a SeekOut job applicant, we may collect or process sensitive personal information from you during the recruitment process, including your race and/or ethnicity. This information is collected solely for the purpose of assessing your application for employment and complying with legal and regulatory requirements. We also use this information to assist us in our diversity, equity, and inclusion efforts. We may also collect and process your Social Security number, driver's license number, or passport number to perform pre-employment background checks.

If you would like to request SeekOut to limit the use of your information or request that we delete any of information we have collected or inferred about you, please submit a request via the Privacy Choices Portal or via email at privacy@seekout.com.

For Candidates Sourced or Recruited via the SeekOut Spot Services

Collection, Use, and Disclosure of Personal Information for Business Purposes

Disclosure of Personal Information for Commercial Purposes

The purpose of the SeekOut Spot services is to source and recruit potential candidates for job opportunities with prospective employers. To match potential candidates with prospective employers, we provide professional information about such candidates to the prospective employers. Such disclosures are further reflected below. We do not disclose personal information from the SeekOut Spot services to third parties for purposes of targeted advertising.

Privacy Rights

For information on privacy rights available under the State Laws and how to exercise your rights, see the Privacy Rights section above.

Authorized Agents

California residents may use an authorized agent to submit privacy requests on their behalf. If you would like to submit a request on behalf of a California resident, please submit the request via the Privacy Choices Portal. Upon submission, you will be required to upload documentation showing proof of written permission from the resident authorizing you to submit a request on their behalf. We reserve the right to require residents to confirm their request and/or identity. We may deny a request from an agent that does not submit proof that they have been authorized by the California resident to act on the California resident's behalf.

Appeals

If we deny your request, you may appeal our decision by contacting us at privacy@seekout.com. If you have concerns about the result of an appeal, you may contact the attorney general in the state where you reside.

10. Additional Information for Individuals in Europe

If you are located in the European Economic Area (“EEA”), the United Kingdom, or Switzerland, the following section applies to you.

Legal Basis for Processing

When we process your personal data as described above, we do so in reliance on the following lawful bases:

To perform our responsibilities under our contract with you (e.g., processing payments for and providing the products and services you requested).

When we have a legitimate interest in processing your personal data to operate our business or protect our interests (e.g., to provide, maintain, and improve our products and services, conduct data analytics, and communicate with you).

To comply with our legal obligations (e.g., to maintain a record of your consents and track those who have opted out of marketing communications).

When we have your consent to do so (e.g., when you opt in to receive marketing communications from us). When consent is the legal basis for our processing your personal data, you may withdraw such consent at any time. This will not affect the lawfulness of our actions before you withdrew your consent.

Special category (“sensitive”) information

We use machine learning-powered functionality to infer “likely” personal characteristics of candidates, which may include ethnicity, to help recruiters easily find highly qualified and diverse candidates. Inferences are not stored on a candidate’s profile within the SeekOut Candidate Database and inferences are not available for export outside of the SeekOut Candidate Database. When we process inferred ethnicity data, we do so in reliance on the following conditions under European data protection law:

The processing is necessary for reasons of substantial public interest, including for the purposes of identifying or keeping under review the existence or absence of equality of opportunity or treatment; or

The information has been manifestly made public by the candidate.

We voluntarily provide you with the ability to opt out of the use of this personal information, as outlined in the “Your Rights and Choices” section of this Privacy Policy.

SeekOut can only fulfill privacy requests with respect to information for which we act as a data controller. For information about personal information we process on behalf of our customers, please contact the relevant customer.

# [Contact Information Credits](https://help.seekout.com/help/contact-info-credits)
Each SeekOut plan includes credits for finding candidate contact info.

Contact information is broken into two categories: Email addresses and phone numbers. Each email contact info credit retrieves email addresses for one candidate. Each phone number contact info credit retrieves phone number information for one candidates.

If we find multiple email addresses or phone numbers for the same candidate, it doesn't cost you additional credits.

Example:

Click Get Email and SeekOut finds one email address, this costs 1 credit.

Click Get Email and SeekOut finds three email addresses, this still only costs 1 credit.

When you request contact info for candidates, we require that you have at least as many contact info credits available as the number of candidates for which you are requesting contact info. If you ask for either email or phone number contact info for 10 candidates, for instance, you need to have at least 10 contact info credits.

As soon as you request candidate contact info, we will deduct that number of credits from your account.

It can take a few minutes to retrieve and verify candidate email addresses and phone numbers. When we're done with that process, we refund credits to you for any candidates where we can't find contact information. For instance, if you had 100 credits and asked for email contact info for 10 candidates, your credits would drop down to 90. If, after searching for contact info and verifying email addresses we are able to find contact info for 8 of those candidates, we would refund 2 credits to you bringing your total number of credits up to 92.

From your SeekOut dashboard, click your name at the bottom left and select Account. On your Account page, click the Buy Contact Credits button under the Your Plan section.

Enter your billing address in the popup and select the quantity of credits you want to purchase. Contact credits are sold in packs of 100, so choosing a quantity of 2 will add 200 credits to your account.

Click Next, then enter your credit card information on the following page. Click Charge to finalize your purchase.

Purchasing Other Network Search Credits

From your SeekOut dashboard, click your initials at the bottom left and select Account. On your Account page, click the Buy Search Add-On button under the Your Plan section.

In the pop-up that appears, enter your billing address and select the quantity of search credits you want. Network Search credits are sold in packs of 2000, so choosing a quantity of 2 will add 4000 credits to your account.

Click Next, then enter your credit card information. Click the Charge button to finalize your purchase.

Purchasing Postal Credits

SeekOut for Healthcare users have the ability to create and send automated letters to nursing and other qualifying healthcare professionals they find using SeekOut.

To purchase additional postal credits, please reach out to your CSM or customer support at support@seekout.com.

How many credits do I have per month and when do they reset?

You can keep track of how many credits you have by clicking on your name in the bottom left corner of your SeekOut screen.

For more details - including when your credits expire - click on that Credit portion of the menu.

# [AI Agents for Recruiting: A Guide for Hiring Teams by SeekOut on 2025-04-10](https://www.seekout.com/blog/ai-agents-for-recruiting)
As a recruiter, you’re no stranger to the constant ebb and flow of hiring. Just as one role wraps up, another lands on your plate. You might have an offer out to a promising candidate only to have them back out or disappear without a word. Sourcing can feel endless, and even with AI tools built into your process, the weight of keeping it all moving still falls on you.

Now imagine if the most repetitive parts of your job, like screening resumes or sourcing candidates, could run smoothly in the background. The tedious work is handled for you, and you’re still in control of the moments that call for human judgment and connection. That’s the promise of AI agents for recruiting: they adapt in real time, take initiative, and free you up to focus on talent strategy.

What used to sound like science fiction (or at least a distant possibility) is now woven into daily hiring workflows. Agentic AI in talent acquisition isn’t on the horizon—it’s here. And it’s already changing how teams source, screen, and hire at scale.

What are AI agents for recruiting?

AI agents are programs that use agentic AI, which is a newer form of artificial intelligence designed to work toward goals without needing constant input. While agentic AI refers to the intelligence that powers decision-making and adaptability, AI agents are the tools that apply this intelligence to real-world tasks.

In recruiting, this means AI agents go beyond the simple tasks of sorting resumes or drafting emails. They can actively search for candidates, send personalized messages, schedule interviews, and refine their approach on the fly.

Here’s what sets agentic AI in hiring apart:

Autonomy: AI agents don’t need step-by-step instructions. They can source candidates, schedule interviews, and progress tasks on their own.

Decision-making: They analyze candidate data, prioritize outreach, and pivot when needed.

Adaptability: As they gather feedback from recruiters and observe candidate behavior, AI agents learn and get better at hitting hiring goals.

AI in talent acquisition has come a long way. We started with early machine learning that could spot patterns. Then came generative AI, which could create content. Now, agentic AI marks the next leap—one where technology takes action.

Agentic AI vs. other AI models in talent acquisition

Until recently, AI in recruiting has mainly supported singular tasks, like surfacing candidates, drafting job descriptions, and sending automated follow-ups. Tools powered by machine learning or generative AI have been helpful but limited. They respond to input and are reactive by design.

Let’s say you’re writing a job description. A traditional AI tool might analyze past hiring data and recommend top candidates using filters, such as years of experience or location. That’s helpful, but agentic AI goes a step further—it screens resumes, pinpoints high-potential candidates, initiates outreach, and updates job criteria according to what’s working in the hiring process.

The same goes for interview follow-ups. While generative AI can help you draft a message, an AI agent can write the email, send it, track whether it’s opened, follow up with a more tailored note, and schedule the interview without you lifting a finger.

Here’s how that plays out across key tasks in the recruiting process:

In each of these scenarios, machine learning and generative AI offer support up to a point, but agentic AI actually does the work. This shift frees up your team to spend less time on repetitive tasks and more time building relationships and making strategic hiring decisions.

Why are AI agents for recruiting a breakthrough?

You’ve probably seen your fair share of AI tools claiming to make recruiting easier. But too often, they just tack on a few shortcuts and leave you to juggle the same long list of tasks. An AI agent changes that. From the moment you log in, your workflow looks and feels different.

With agentic AI by your side, here’s what shifts:

No more micromanaging tools

AI agents don’t need handholding. Once they understand the goal—say, filling a role with five years of experience in a specific market—they jump into action. You’re no longer bouncing between job boards, adjusting filters, or tracking candidate lists manually.

The AI agent is already:

searching across platforms, including niche networks.

reaching out to promising candidates.

tweaking its search using early feedback.

You still have control, but you’re not in the weeds pushing every button.

More time for meaningful conversations

When the busy work is off your plate, you get to spend your time on the parts of recruiting that require a human touch.

Instead of squeezing in interviews between calendar coordination, you get to:

spend more time preparing for conversations.

personalize your outreach in ways that resonate.

support hiring managers with thoughtful coaching.

That reclaimed time is your opportunity to double down on candidate experience, which is where human connection still matters most.

Smarter processes without the extra effort

Every task your AI agent completes, whether it’s a follow-up email or a rescheduled interview, feeds into its learning. Over time, it starts to understand the nuances of your roles, your industry, and your candidate pool.

For example, maybe candidates in a certain market respond better to early morning messages. Your AI agent will notice that trend and adjust its timing automatically with no reminders or reprogramming needed. As you dedicate time to making connections, a continuous improvement occurs behind the scenes.

How should I use AI agents for recruiting?

You don’t need to tear down your current process to start using agentic AI for recruiting. The best approach is to layer it into places where it can take the biggest load off your plate. Think of an AI agent as your teammate who handles the repetitive work.

Here’s where agentic AI can make the most impact:

Source smarter without the endless scroll

Even the best recruiters have limits on hours in a day, platforms you can search, and profiles you can reasonably review. AI agents in hiring source deeper and wider than a human ever could, scanning thousands of profiles across job boards, professional communities, and niche networks in minutes.

Machine learning and generative AI models rely on specific algorithms and prompts—think complex Boolean searches. But agentic AI can evaluate work history, growth patterns, and career moves to surface strong-fit candidates who may not have popped up otherwise.

Screen candidates through a wider lens

Forget keyword matching and hoping your ATS gets it right. With agentic AI for talent acquisition, screening becomes smarter and more aligned with your actual hiring goals.

These AI systems can apply a custom rubric—like your team’s definition of “What Good Looks Like”—to evaluate candidates based on what truly matters for the role. That might include technical experience, career trajectory, or specific accomplishments, not just title or tenure.

As a human recruiter gives feedback on which candidates move forward, the AI learns and refines its shortlist, so that each slate better meets your expectations.

Personalize outreach at scale

It’s easy to lose personalization in candidate outreach when doing it manually or using generic templates, but with AI agents for recruiting, that’s no longer an issue. These systems tailor messages to each individual and draw on their experience, interests, and activity across platforms. They’re written to bypass the “junk” folder and increase the chances of a response.

Here’s an example of an initial outreach email using agentic AI:

Agentic AI can also test different messaging styles, track engagement, and follow up automatically if someone doesn’t reply. You're still in control of the messaging, but you're not spending hours copying, pasting, and editing emails.

Continuous optimization you don’t have to manage

One of the biggest advantages of agentic AI for HR is that it learns as it goes. As you hire, pass, or provide input, the system tracks patterns and adjusts its approach. This ultimately gives you more bandwidth to review candidates who fit the role.

Because they learn from real outcomes, AI agents for recruiting can also help reduce unconscious bias and surface candidates who may otherwise be overlooked. If your team is scaling quickly, navigating a hard-to-fill role, or hiring outside your typical expertise, AI agents ensure you make headway so you can keep your focus on the bigger picture.

How SeekOut balances AI agents with human oversight

AI is changing the way teams recruit, but it’s not replacing the people behind the process. At SeekOut, we believe the best results come from blending the speed and agility of AI with the judgment, empathy, and experience humans bring to the table.

With SeekOut Spot, our end-to-end recruiting service our expert human recruiters work alongside AI agents. While AI agents do the legwork on sourcing, screening, and personalized outreach, a dedicated SeekOut recruiter interprets results and keeps the process centered on finding the right fit.

For many busy teams, learning how to use advanced tools like agentic AI requires time and resources that aren’t available. Spot removes these barriers and gives you access to advanced recruiting technology without a learning curve or hefty price tag. At the same time, you get a Spot recruiter to guide decisions throughout the process.

The collaboration starts with a 30-minute kickoff meeting. You and your SeekOut Spot recruiter align on role requirements, capturing the must-haves, nice-to-haves, and any context that defines success for the position.

From there, Spot’s agentic AI gets to work. On day one, it generates a What Good Looks Like (WGLL) rubric using your input. This rubric becomes the foundation for evaluating thousands of profiles for deep signals, including work history, career trajectory, and relevant experience.

Once you approve the rubric, the AI performs candidate research by sourcing broadly and evaluating potential matches at scale. By days two and three, Spot’s AI agent begins personalized outreach with multi-step, tailored engagement to connect with candidates.

In as little as two weeks, your Spot recruiter uses their extensive recruiting experience to screen candidates for fit and confirm interest. They then present you with a slate of high-quality candidates who are aligned with your goals and ready to move forward.

Putting agentic AI into practice

When hiring ramps up, it’s easy to fall behind, especially if your team is juggling multiple roles with limited time. SeekOut Spot was built for those moments. Whether you're in the middle of a hiring surge or just don’t have the bandwidth to manage everything in-house, it helps you stay agile without sacrificing quality.

With Spot, a dedicated SeekOut recruiter acts as an extension of your team. They bring in the human insight and hiring expertise, and AI agents handle the time-consuming tasks.

If you're looking for a way to source deeper, screen smarter, and keep your hiring process on track, an AI agent for recruiting may be worth exploring.

# [Data-driven Diversity: 4 Ways Your Team Can Start 2021 on the Right Path by SeekOut on 2020-12-14](https://www.seekout.com/blog/data-driven-diversity-4-ways-your-team-can-start-2021-on-the-right-path)
Diversity and inclusion are top of mind for many company leaders today. It’s the right thing to do to combat social injustice, and research has shown that diverse teams perform better overall. But finding more diverse candidates to interview is one of the biggest barriers to improving diversity.

Data can help. In fact, 81 percent of attendees on a recent webinar agreed it would be helpful to have diversity statistics for setting and achieving goals. However, 91 percent said they had difficulty finding the statistics they needed.

The right data can help you and your team think more strategically about how to approach diversity hiring in 2021.

1. Setting realistic diversity targets

It’s common for HR leaders to be given corporate diversity targets, but they may not always be realistic. Taking a more proactive approach with data can help you get a seat at the table while goals are being discussed and set.

Understand your talent pool demographics by looking at your competitors’ demographic data, as well as regional demographic data. Compare that to your own data to find opportunities to improve. For example, if 3 percent of your workforce is comprised of Black employees, but 10 percent of your regional population are Black, consider how you might better attract and retain Black workers.

Break down demographic data by seniority, discipline, and specific roles to find exactly where you should focus your diversity recruitment efforts. For example, if your competitor and regional data show a higher percentage of Black software engineers than you have on your team, you will know you have a strong opportunity to hire more talent from that group.

2. Strategically advising hiring managers to craft better job requirements

A Hewlett Packard internal report found that men apply for a job when they meet 60 percent of the qualifications, but women apply only if they meet 100 percent of them. Your hiring managers may be inadvertently derailing your diversity recruiting efforts with long lists of must-have skills and qualifications.

Empower your talent acquisition team to have data-driven conversations around job requirements, so they can become true strategic advisors to your hiring managers. For example, they can show how the original job requirements yielded only 50 candidates across the country, with only a handful from underrepresented groups. By removing unnecessary skill, location, or title requirements, they can show hiring managers how to access a larger, more diverse talent pool.

3. Strategically sourcing and submitting diverse slates

Traditionally, sourcers have uncovered candidates from underrepresented groups by building Boolean strings based on where diverse people are. But many of these strings aren’t accurate—and may even introduce bias. For example, searching the top 100 US female names finds less than 20 percent of women, and those women will be predominately white. A quarter of Historically black colleges and universities (HBCUs) students aren’t Black, and only 9 percent of Black college students attend HBCUs.

Dig into your data to see where candidates from underrepresented groups are coming from, and use that to refine your sourcing strategy. For instance, what companies have they worked for, where are they located, and what colleges did they attend? Help your team go beyond traditionally-used search strings by investing in sourcing platforms that use data and AI to accurately find candidates from underrepresented groups, and reduce bias.

And when hiring managers submit slates to hiring managers, encourage them to include at least two women and two minorities. Studies have shown that a more diverse slate of candidates increases the probability of hiring someone from an underrepresented group.

4. Diagnosing bottlenecks in the talent funnel

Finally, use data to uncover breakdowns in your talent funnel. Is there a stage where candidates from underrepresented groups are disproportionately screened out of your hiring process? Is your turnover rate higher for employees from underrepresented groups?

Diagnosing pitfalls in your talent funnel can guide you toward solutions. For example, blind resume reviews can reduce bias early in the process, while structured interviews and assessments can reduce bias later on.

But simply hiring a candidate from an underrepresented group doesn’t help you build a more diverse workforce if you can’t retain them. Keep a pulse on why employees are leaving, so you can provide more transparency in the hiring process—or move to enact change.

Final thoughts on data-driven diversity

There is a great opportunity for your team to leverage data and insights to set diversity targets, become talent advisors to your hiring managers, and achieve or exceed your targets. But increasing representation at the top of your talent funnel is only part of the equation.

Candidates from underrepresented groups should feel included, and know that their different personal experiences and ways of thinking are accepted and celebrated. Diversity, inclusion, and belonging are all very important, and need to be thought about concurrently to achieve true progress and better outcomes.

Ready to build a more talented, diverse team? Get a demo to see how SeekOut provides you the needed diversity talent insights to get a competitive edge in recruiting hard-to-find and diverse talent.

SeekOut is the #1 rated diversity recruiting software on G2 Crowd.

Jen Dewar, SeekOut Content Writer

# [Recruiting Email Templates that Engage Passive Candidates by SeekOut on 2025-04-22](https://www.seekout.com/blog/recruitment-email-templates)
Most recruiting emails get ignored, and it's easy to understand why. When someone isn’t job searching, your message becomes just another advertisement in the abyss. If your outreach doesn’t catch both the inbox filter and the reader’s eye, it often disappears before it’s even opened.

About 70% of the workforce are passive candidates. These professionals aren’t checking job boards, but that doesn’t mean they aren’t open to the right opportunity. The challenge is grabbing their attention without sounding like every other recruiter reaching out.

Strong recruiting email templates can offer a foundation for you to build from. The key is to use them as starting points instead of copy-and-paste scripts. With initial email response rates sitting between 30 and 50%, reaching the higher end (or exceeding it) requires thoughtful, personalized messaging.

Your choice of words, your tone, and how you connect with the person behind the profile all make a real difference.

Common recruiting email template mistakes

Below are common mistakes that can tank your outreach before it even starts:

Using the wrong email address

Many recruiters rely on default communication channels like LinkedIn InMail, but response rates there continue to drop. Candidates receive multiple InMails a week, and many admit they rarely check that inbox at all.

If your message ends up in a dormant account or secondary inbox, it doesn’t matter how personalized or compelling it is. To improve your delivery rate, start with better contact data. SeekOut Recruit offers access to verified email addresses, making it easy to reach passive candidates through the channels they actually use.

If your team needs more support, SeekOut Spot’s fully managed service option takes it even further with a dedicated recruiter and agentic AI working together to bring you a slate of qualified, interested candidates.

Sounding like a recruiter email template

It might seem counterintuitive, but the most effective recruiting email templates don’t feel like templates at all.

If your message opens with a generic line and jumps straight into a job description, most candidates will stop reading. Passive candidates aren’t scanning their inbox looking for opportunities. If your email feels like it was sent to a list instead of a person, it won’t spark interest.

Use templates as a foundation but always add a human touch. Even one personalized detail can increase your chances of getting a response.

Asking for too much too soon

If your first message asks a passive candidate to send a resume or fill out an application, you’re probably asking too much.

Keep the initial outreach low-pressure. Your goal is to open the door, not close the deal.

A simple call-to-action, like confirming if they’re open to hearing more, makes it easier for candidates to engage without committing to anything upfront. A clear, one-sentence CTA that only asks for interest or permission to follow up is often all you need to keep the conversation going.

What makes a great email template for recruiters?

Now that you know what not to do, let’s focus on what makes a recruiting email worth reading and responding to.

Most candidates don’t have the time or interest to figure out if a message is relevant. If you want their attention, your email needs to answer one simple question: “What’s in it for me?”

Here’s what separates the best recruiting emails from the ones that get ignored:

Focusing on the candidate

Instead of starting with what the company needs, start with what the candidate might care about. What’s in it for them? Highlight what makes the role appealing, whether that’s the team they’d join, the flexibility offered, or how the work connects to their background.

Including real details

A vague title and “great opportunity” won’t help someone decide if it’s worth a conversation. Include the basics: role, location or remote option, pay range, team structure, and a brief note about what makes the position unique.

Making it personal

Even if you’re using a recruiting email template, it should read like you took a moment to learn about the person you’re contacting. Mention their current company, a skill they’ve listed, or something from their background that shows you’re not sending the same message to everyone.

Ending with a clear ask

If your call to action requires too much effort, most people won’t respond. Avoid asking for resumes or including scheduling links in the first message. Instead, try something simple like:

Would you be open to a quick intro chat?

Can I share more about the role?

Would sometime this week work to connect?

Bonus tip: Don't stop at one email

Even when you craft your recruiting email templates perfectly, most people won’t respond to your first email. But that’s not a sign you’ve done something wrong, it just means they’re busy or unsure if it’s worth their time. That’s why it helps to think beyond one message. A short follow-up sequence gives you more chances to catch someone at the right moment. Across 4 or 5 emails, you can highlight different aspects of the role, keep the tone low-pressure, and remind the candidate why you reached out to them specifically. Just make sure each message is targeted and adds value.

Email subject line strategies that grab attention

When it comes to getting a response, your lead-in makes all the difference. The subject line is the first thing your candidate sees, and it's often the reason they decide to open your message. Passive candidates receive dozens of emails a day, so your subject line needs to stand out. The most effective cold email subject lines follow one of three approaches:

Highlight the candidate’s strengths

Children’s author Arnold Lobel said that “nothing is harder to resist than a bit of flattery.” That’s why subject lines like, “Impressive experience” or “Loved your project at [Company]” work because they tap into the human desire to feel valued. Even well-worn phrases can stand out when they’re authentic and specific.

Here are some subject line examples:

Your work on the Mercury pricing model rollout was seriously impressive

Really liked how you approached customer churn at Brightwave

You’ve built something solid at Finlogic—wanted to connect

Show you did your homework

Personalization signals effort, and effort earns attention. If you know the candidate’s location, interests, or background, include it in the subject line. With SeekOut Recruit's power filters, you can search by interests and more.

For example, if you’re searching for a Senior Financial Analyst in New York, you can refine your results down to candidates who attended a top 50 university and have an interest in reading.

Then, your subject line can be something like:

"Thinking in Bets is a UVA alum’s work. Have you read it?"

Your email's intro could then be:

“Hi Janet, I noticed you went to the same school as one of my favorite writers, Annie Duke. She wrote Thinking in Bets, which talks about how sharp analysts approach risk, and it made me think of a role we’re hiring for that could be a great fit for you.”

You’re not inviting them to book club, but you’re showing that you noticed something beyond their title and skills. Personalizing subject lines can help you stand out from the dozens of generic messages they’re used to.

Spark curiosity

Avoid subject lines that give everything away. If your message reads like a job posting before it's even opened, you’re giving passive candidates a reason to skip it. Instead, aim for subject lines that hint at value without spelling it out, such as:

A finance role that fits how you think about risk

Your work at Redbridge Capital made me want to reach out

A new opportunity that lines up with your background in finance

The goal here isn’t to be vague but to make the recipient curious enough to open the email and learn more.

How to personalize recruiter email templates at scale

89% of senior marketers agree that personalization works, but when you're reaching out to dozens—or even hundreds—of passive candidates, writing one-to-one messages for everyone isn’t realistic.

The key is learning how to personalize at scale. You don’t need to reinvent the wheel for every message. A few smart adjustments can make a bulk email feel like it was written just for the reader.

Here are four fields you can easily tailor in your recruiting email templates:

Name: This is non-negotiable. You can use it in the subject line and the body.

Location: Mentioning the candidate’s city or region shows you’re paying attention. For example: “I’m currently looking for top engineering talent in Boston.”

Job Title or Company: Referencing their role or employer adds relevance. Try: “I know [Company] is known for strong design leadership, which is why I wanted to connect.”

Interests: If the candidate’s profile mentions something unique—like reading, travel, or golf—mention it. For example: “Saw you’re into golf. Ever played Pound Ridge?”

Platforms like SeekOut Recruit make this easier by helping you surface these details quickly. But if your team doesn’t have time to sort through filters and manually adjust messages, SeekOut Spot can take this off your plate entirely.

With SeekOut Spot, an expert recruiter works with you to understand your hiring goals and must-haves. Using Spot’s agentic AI, they search broadly, dig deep, and personalize outreach based on candidate traits. Then, they provide you with a curated list of highly qualified candidates.

Bonus tip: Make it easy to respond

Most candidates will read your message on their phone. That means long paragraphs, requests for resumes, and “when are you free to chat?” messages usually get ignored.

Instead, write with mobile behavior in mind. Keep the ask simple. A one-click or one-word reply is far more likely to get a response than a complicated scheduling request.

Here’s an example of a mobile-friendly call-to-action: “If I don’t hear back here, I’ll try giving you a quick call around lunchtime on Wednesday. If there’s a better time, feel free to reply and let me know.”

This approach works because you take the initiative to suggest a time, you leave the door open for them to adjust it, and you set the expectation that a follow-up is coming.

Best cold email templates for recruiters with examples

Cold recruiting emails work best when they’re adapted to the person you’re reaching out to. Below are example templates you can adjust to fit different outreach scenarios—each designed to help you start meaningful conversations with passive candidates.

Passive candidate outreach with personalization

This template uses location and interests to personalize the message in a way that feels human and specific. It leads with recognition and closes with a simple ask, making it easy for the candidate to reply without pressure.

Subject: Opportunity in [Location] + a team that values [Trait or Interest]

Hi [First Name],

I came across your profile while sourcing [Job Titles] in [City] and was impressed by your work at [Candidate Company] and your interest in [Interest]. At [Your Company], we’re building [Brief Mission or Product Summary].

We’re hiring for a [Job Title] role that offers [Job Feature], a [$X–$Y] salary range, and a collaborative team that values [Culture Trait or Work Style].

Are you open to a 15-minute call this week to see if it’s a fit?

Best, [Your Name] [Recruiter Title], [Your Company]

Referral-based recruiting email template

Referrals add instant credibility. This message gets to the point quickly and keeps the tone casual and open-ended, which works well for passive candidates who aren’t actively job seeking.

Subject: [Referral Name] suggested I reach out — [Job Title] role

Hi [First Name],

[Referral Name] spoke highly of your work and mentioned you might be a great fit for a role we’re hiring for at [Your Company]. Based on your experience with [Relevant Skill/Focus Area] at [Candidate Company], I thought it would be worth a quick conversation.

We’re hiring a [Job Title] to join our [Team or Department]. It’s a [Remote/Hybrid/In-Office] role, salary range is [$X–$Y], and you'd be working on [Brief Description of Team/Project Impact].

Are you open to chatting sometime this week?

Best, [Your Name] [Recruiter Title], [Your Company]

Shared background or alumni connection email template

Common ground, like a shared alma mater or past company, builds trust fast. This email uses that connection to warm up the conversation and create a sense of familiarity, while keeping the CTA low lift.

Subject: From one [School Name or Past Company] alum to another—thought this might interest you

Hi [First Name],

Always nice to come across another [School Name/Past Company] grad. Your work at [Candidate Company] stood out—especially [Specific Accomplishment, Project, or Focus].

At [Your Company], we’re looking for a [Job Title] to help shape how we [Team’s Mission or Product Impact]. The role is [Hybrid/Remote/In-Office], includes full benefits, and offers a salary range of [$X–$Y]. You’d be working directly with [Leader/Team] on [Brief Objective].

Are you open to a quick chat to see if this aligns with what you're looking for?

Warmly, [Your Name] [Recruiter Title], [Your Company]

Recruitment email template for targeting talent at a specific company

This version shows the candidate that you’ve done your homework and are reaching out for a reason. By focusing on their company and experience, it feels personal, even in a bulk outreach context.

Subject: Your work at [Candidate Company] caught my eye

Hi [First Name],

I’ve been connecting with leaders from [Candidate Company], and your background stood out right away. The systems and tools you’ve helped build align closely with what we’re working on at [Your Company].

We’re hiring a [Job Title] to lead [Team or Function] as we expand our [Product/Platform]. The role offers [Remote/Hybrid/In-Office] flexibility, a salary range of [$X–$Y], and the opportunity to make an impact alongside a [Team Type] team.

Are you open to a quick conversation this week?

Best, [Your Name] [Recruiter Title], [Your Company]

Use SeekOut to make email outreach easier

Creating effective outreach starts with good writing, but it doesn’t end there. The best recruiting email templates land in the right inbox, at the right time, with a message that speaks to the person receiving it.

If you want to personalize at scale, SeekOut Recruit can help. You can quickly filter for candidate traits like location, interests, past employers, and education, and access verified email addresses, so your message doesn’t disappear into a long-abandoned inbox. It’s everything you need to send smarter, more tailored messages that candidates actually want to open.

And if writing, sourcing, or following up feels out of reach right now, SeekOut Spot offers another path. You set the goals, and Spot combines the precision of AI with a dedicated recruiter to search broadly, refine outreach, and connect with candidates on your behalf.

Whether you're writing your own messages or need help finding and reaching the right candidates, SeekOut can simplify the process, so your outreach feels more personal and gets better results.

# SeekOut, founded 2016-08-01 [(Crunchbase, 2025)](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/seekout)
SeekOut is the next generation AI sourcing solution, enabling TA teams to recruit hard-to-find and diverse talent faster. The developers, experts, leaders and diverse talent who will have a 10X impact on your company can't be found with traditional tools. SeekOut helps you discover and engage these candidates so you can help propel your company forward with key hires.What makes SeekOut special: Unique sourcing solution for GitHub so recruiters are first to find untapped deep tech talent. First in industry sourcing solution and talent insights for over 80 million profiles in engineering and life sciences based on patents and research publications, so you get first to the innovation leaders. One-click access to millions of diverse candidates so recruiters can become a diversity hero. Best-in-class AI search over 500M profiles for tech and non-tech roles, so recruiters spend more time on added-value work. Industry-leading contact info and automated message campaigns so recruiters achieve high response rates. Custom search engines for 37 social networks/websites so recruiters have the most expansive view on available talent.With these capabilities, SeekOut can also reduce the investment need for multiple tools, while improving your ROI.
