reviews.advice: Keep doing what you're doing—but never lose that spark that makes SeekOut feel like the rarest thing in tech: a company that leads with its soul. The way you approach interviews is a masterclass in treating people like, well… people. Don’t ever change that.
reviews.cons: If you’re looking for a place to clock in, zone out, and coast through the day, this probably isn’t it. SeekOut attracts people who care—maybe a little too much—and that level of passion can be intense if you’re not wired the same way. But that’s also what makes it great.
reviews.pros:
The interview process at SeekOut was what every candidate hopes for but rarely finds—transparent, thoughtful, and human. From start to finish, I felt genuinely seen, heard, and valued. Conversations were real—not robotic. Everyone I spoke with approached the process with warmth, intellect, and a shared sense of purpose. They weren’t just checking boxes—they were making sure it was the right fit, for both sides.

Rejoining SeekOut felt less like taking a job and more like returning to a place where I’ve always belonged. The culture? Still electric. The mission? Even more relevant. The people? Absolute rockstars.
reviews.summary: Like Coming Home to the Coolest House on the Block

reviews.advice: Your VP of Product is holding you back.
reviews.cons: Outside of the design team, specifically among upper management, it was "my way or the highway." Any dissension, no matter how researched, data-proven, or user-studied was met with "but that's not how I would use it." Management's lack of understanding of product development and design is a large hindrance on the company.
reviews.pros: Within the design team, when it existed, there was encouragement and collaboration and advocation for the users. Experience and research was well utilized, and feedback was constructive and acted on appropriately. The design team, in partnership with engineering, was as ideal as it could be.

reviews.cons: No cell phone stipend or reimbursement for new device.
reviews.pros: Great group of people that are kind and welcoming! Helpful and a ton of great resources.

reviews.cons: No cons so far - I'm just started.
reviews.pros:
Interview: Company has really good and fast interview process. Everyone was friendly and generally nobody want you to push to fail. 

Office: Company has nice office in Downtown Bellevue and provide all nice facilities (small gym, parking), paid lunches, rest and game room, kitchen and etc. Office are good, quite and cozy.

reviews.cons: Can't think of one for now...
reviews.pros: Great engineers. Good office location with lots of perks. Terrific co-workers on my team.
reviews.summary: Brand new, glad to be here

reviews.cons: Product updates are slow to launch
reviews.pros: Feel very supported and collaborative

reviews.cons: Leadership can’t speak to how the product is improving customer’s experience and only focused on closing deals
reviews.pros: Great people and a promising product

reviews.advice: Do what you are supposed to do as leaders and humans and actually protect the wellbeing of the people who are working to make you rich.
reviews.cons: A few individuals are the very definition of toxic and they hold the rest of the company in a constant swirl of anxiety, frustration, and feeling gaslighted. On the surface leadership espouses how much they care about culture and gratitude, but under the covers they protect and even participate in belittling, undermining, disrespecting, and cutthroat behaviors. They believe they are better than everyone else and never look in the mirror at the destruction and pain they are wreaking in almost all areas of the company. The insidious part is that they hide their behavior behind the excuse of having “high standards” and every attempt to call attention to their behavior is twisted into blaming those that speak up. All who try to change things for the better are systematically discredited and discarded. You’ll learn about the long history of victims that have gone through this when you join. When you look at the quality of the product you’ll understand that they are actually not competent at leading a team that can build a great product or support great sales and CS teams. Overall this place could be great. They operate in an interesting product space and have some great people working there, but the fact that leadership not only fails to protect its employees from the toxicity, but protects and rewards it, is unacceptable. Everyone should avoid this place unless looking for an immersive lesson in workplace toxicity.
reviews.pros: Truly kind and talented people throughout the company.
reviews.summary: The toxic culture you read about in books

reviews.advice: Ensure your top performers are engaged enough with internal career movement.
reviews.cons: Lack of career opportunities. Focused too much on external talent vs. the internal talent that could have been interested/moved into opportunities.
reviews.pros: I was provided a great work life balance.
reviews.summary: Great Culture - Opportunity to Improve Products and Operations

reviews.cons:
SeekOut was by far the most toxic, soul-sucking, and dysfunctional organization I have ever worked for. All of the issues can be traced back to top-level leadership that lacks any semblance of strategy, accountability, and basic humanity. Bullying behavior from the CEO and leaders in his inner circle were not only allowed, but rewarded with promotions. Incompetent VPs micromanaged every detail of downstream teams, severely hindering autonomy and productivity.

Backstabbing, demeaning language, and blaming others were a common occurrence. Every team across the organization was aware of the problems, but leadership instilled a culture of fear and retaliation. Well-meaning employees who surfaced concerns were ignored and/or punished with public humiliation, more work, or simply fired.

Leadership's definition of 'product strategy' was copying our competitors, or straight up lying to customers about what the product does to close a sale, leaving other teams in a horrible position to scramble and try and deliver on impossible promises. Gaslighting happened at every level, with priorities constantly changing, and lower-level employees blamed for the misdirection. 

The result of this impossibly toxic culture? Dissatisfied customers, multiple quarters of missed growth targets, constant turnover of high-performing employees, and 3 major layoffs in less than 1.5yrs. This company is literally burning to the ground, and the leaders have nobody to blame but themselves. But it's highly unlikely that group of cowards are brave enough to look in the mirror and take any accountability.
reviews.pros: Nice people at lower levels (although many were axed in the latest round of layoffs). Also, they have a nice espresso machine in the office.

reviews.cons: No solid sales structure through org.
reviews.pros: No micromanagement and freedom to do job.

reviews.cons: N/A (no cons for me)
reviews.pros: - Very warm, supportive, inclusive culture - Lots of opportunities to learn and grow - Very kind and nice manager - Nice compensation and perks

reviews.advice: N/a
reviews.cons: There's nothing that I could say
reviews.pros: SeekOut is my first job after I graduated from college, and I couldn't be happier with this choice. SeekOut continues to lead with empathy and kindness - which makes me happy to wake up every morning to work! We truly stand by our values and constantly lead with gratitude.

reviews.advice: So far, the onboarding process has been nothing but transparent, open for all questions and supportive.
reviews.cons: There isn't a single negative thing I could say about working for SeekOut. Such an inclusive and welcoming environment!
reviews.pros: My recruiter Nina was absolutely incredible. She was there every step of the way providing me with feedback and support throughout the interview process. Also, every single person I have met at SeekOut so far has been so enthusiastic, kind, supportive and relatable.

reviews.advice: Invest in customer, partner and channel relationships to drive demand gen and advocacy.
reviews.cons: Hyper growth on team can be hard to keep up with.
reviews.pros: Strong product and support from executives through management and across all teams.

reviews.advice: Always keep the focus and drive to deliver the best for our customers however far we reach. Hire top talent. Continue building great products, safeguard our culture. Make the journey fun for everyone.
reviews.cons: Every company has its own challenges, as we scale. Product, processes, team - everything is continuously evolving, we move fast even in the face of ambiguity. The work environment is challenging, we have tight timelines and targets, everyone is laser focused. If you're looking for a comfortable job, this may not be the right fit.
reviews.pros:
SeekOut is a really special place to be, I truly believe we are on to something extraordinary.

1. It starts with people. People here are very talented, still down to earth and humble starting from top down. The company is customer focused, leadership team genuinely cares about employees and their well being. 

2. We are building a product that is at the core of helping companies find right talent. The product is exemplary and way ahead of the competition. We have a strong roadmap to become one of the industry leaders in talent acquisition platform space. 

3. Communication is very open and transparent. We are focused on our customers and care for employees. There are fun activities planned almost every month. We celebrate each other's successes. People come here from diverse cultures, values, and beliefs - all belong here and thrive.

4. Everyone has an opportunity to do significant meaningful work. There is a lot of flexibility in how you do your work as long as you deliver excellent results. Opportunities for career growth are tremendous as company grows. The company has learning and wellness benefits which are great.
reviews.summary: Awesome place to build new things, have meaningful impact, learn, and grow!

reviews.cons: I was hired during Covid, and as such I haven't been into the office...so, it'd be really nice to actually meet my colleagues in person.
reviews.pros:
Leadership has incredible depth of previous experience...and they draw from it every day. Can-do mentality is pervasive across the whole organization...from product, to customer success, to sales.

I've worked in sales with many early stage tech startups over the past 20 years, and without exception, there has been a palpable sense of building the airplane as it's speeding down the runway. SeekOut is the first early stage startup I've worked with where this feeling is absent... and yet the active, dynamic, productive, and fun environment that is such an allure of startups is woven into the DNA of the company, even through a pandemic, where the only interaction is through Zoom and Teams calls. 

From a sales perspective, the compensation structure is fair and clearly laid out. Additionally, while it's a relatively complex SaaS sales process, the product is of such high quality (and in such high demand), that customers not only end up purchasing and renewing, but they want to be sure their whole team has access. Of course, the possibility for this kind of expansion is aided by the fact that we have a super attentive and knowledgeable Customer Success team.

Ultimately though, the primary quality that stands above the rest is the integrity of each person on the SeekOut team, and the bar for this is set at the top with Anoop and the four other members of our founding team.
reviews.summary: Best Of Both Worlds: Start-up Culture, With Experienced, Engaged, And Proactive Leadership

reviews.advice: Keep listening to customers and building an inclusive culture. Hire the right people and let's keep moving forward. I have no concerns about the current culture or direction of the product. Let's do this!
reviews.cons: Like at any startup environment, SeekOut is constantly growing and evolving. Because of this, sometimes operational support for particular things may not be established yet. That said, when gaps are found, leadership is eager to jump in and smooth things out and set up a process that is good for all parties.
reviews.pros: Some of the most humble yet capable leadership I have ever been exposed to. The founding team has a great track record of success in software but they're humble, they listen to employees and customers and develop what is needed for the talent acquisition space. We are still small and working to achieve a diverse workforce and it is something that is a part of the core values of the organization. I've also been impressed with how they sell into new customers. The team is transparent about what can and can't be done with our software and wants to make sure that every piece of new business is set up to renew for the upcoming year. Before I got here I knew that there was a huge fanbase of users in the talent acquisition space. Now that I'm here, I know that all of the buzz was warranted.
reviews.summary: Positive Environment. Solid Engineering. Compassionate Leadership

reviews.advice: Stay customer focused, continue to innovate technically, and keep hiring team players who are smart and low-ego.
reviews.cons: Since we're a growing startup, there is always more work to do than people to do it. You need to manage your work-life balance and boundaries to make sure you stay healthy. We're growing fast and always improving, so you need to be flexible and able to deal with ambiguity well.
reviews.pros:
SeekOut is a great product, but the team isn't content to rest. The entire company is driven to help recruiters and HR teams be their best. 

The whole SeekOut team supports one another -- especially with the pandemic, it's important to know your teammates will help you. There are no jerks on the team and everyone's contributions are valued. Due to COVID, we're no longer in the same office all together, but we still stay connected while we're working from our homes.

The management team is smart, driven, and experienced enough to run the company effectively. Anoop gets to know every employee and everyone has a voice about the direction of the company.

I'm so fortunate to be working at SeekOut -- especially during such a challenging time.
reviews.summary: Great company - terrific product, fun team, strong management

reviews.advice: Continue to keep a close eye on our culture and values as we expand, and don't lose sight of what really matters - our users!
reviews.cons: Like many startups, this is an environment in which priorities can quickly change and there's often quite a lot of ambiguity as we find the right path forward. Growth brings its own challenges, especially around hiring, and it can sometime be a bit of a balancing act to keep everything aligned.
reviews.pros: SeekOut is small (~50 ppl), successful startup with a strong leadership team and a great product that's well loved by users. Leading the Customer Success team I've been delighted by the top-down support from the rest of the Executive Team to ensure we remain Customer Obsessed. While in an industry that was hard-hit in the early days of Covid (recruiting intelligence), we made it through 2020 with no layoffs and strong growth. The company has successfully adapted to a fully remote working environment and remains very collaborative. We have a strong, diverse team that feels very inclusive. There's a great deal of excitement for what 2021 will bring as we continue to expand and grow at a rapid pace.

reviews.advice: Practice what you preach.
reviews.cons: The work and personal life balance at SeekOut is significantly imbalanced, with little regard for employees' personal time. SeekOut appears to prioritize engineering-led growth, with the product roadmap often determined by anecdotes from random customers or mimicking competitor actions. Meetings and conversations with the CEO at SeekOut can be challenging, as bullying behaviors are often displayed. SeekOut's focus appears to be scattered due to a "do everything" mentality, resulting in a lack of direction. SeekOut does not consistently utilize its own product when searching for new hires, which may indicate a lack of faith in the effectiveness of their own platform. SeekOut's intense commitment to a new product is questionable, as there seems to be minimal interest from potential buyers.
reviews.pros: Decent compensation. Good mission and focus on diversity.

reviews.cons: There can be more focus on keeping up with the competition versus improving parts of the core product to be the best they possibly can.
reviews.pros: Collaborative culture. Innovative environment. Results driven.

reviews.cons: Constant work and meetings. Long hours
reviews.pros: Inclusive, fun , generous, diverse, all ages

reviews.cons: None so far and I don't expect any.

reviews.summary: All I can think of is WOW!

reviews.advice: Address Employee Morale Act on Feedback Financial Stewardship Stop laying off top sales talent
reviews.cons: The absence of effective leadership from the CEO to lower levels is evident, resulting in a company grappling with operational deficiencies, unaddressed feedback, and two rounds of layoffs, all of which have severely dampened employee morale
reviews.pros: Started off great but went downhill quickly

reviews.cons: Highly reactive environment, which can be good with some product decisions. Overall felt the company was stretched to thin with heavy emphasis on agility
reviews.pros: Great people and community within the organization. Surrounded by supportive and genuinely kind people. Additionally, the product is great. It provides a great tool to recruiters and hiring teams.

reviews.advice: Keep doing what you are doing! Having such a great culture of kindness and gratitude, along with the level of transparency has made being here a wonderful experience!
reviews.cons: SeekOut is very much in the growth period of the startup cycle. There is a lot of work to be done to improve processes and infrastructure, but that is expected when you go through the growth spurt that we have. Additionally, we are very deliberate in our growth and have leaner teams which definitely creates a lot of work. However, self care is a huge priority for the company, so it never feels like overwork.
reviews.pros: The thing that stood out most to me about SeekOut were the "buzz" words being used throughout my interview and the first month of my tenure. Rather than the typical tech startup buzz words, the ones that were used the most were: kind, gracious, and curious. I think that has built a culture of people that are genuinely kind and have that at the forefront of their mind. Being fully remote in a rapid growth startup can have its negative impacts from a cultural perspective, but SeekOut has put the human element first and it shines through in every interaction!

reviews.advice: Don’t be afraid to have a stance and strategy that align, practice the transparency and openness that you often vocalize
reviews.cons: No clear direction and alignment on where the company or product is going. Priorities shift constantly and leadership does not seem to all be on the same page, in some cases lacking the ability to be open minded to different perspectives or pushback. Strategy and identity seem to be unclear from the top down.
reviews.pros: Decent compensation and benefits offered, nice people and fast paced

reviews.advice: Keep focusing on bringing in great people, and driving focus on execution and results. In these crazy economic times, create clarity, generate energy, and let's deliver and celebrate success together.
reviews.cons: It is a fast growing startup that has doubled in size over the last 12 months, and probably quadrupled over last 2 years. With such fast growth, it is natural to have growing pains, new systems, new leaders, evolving strategy, ... If you're not someone who thrives in startup's fast pace, comfortable with ambigiuity and change, ... it may not be ideal place for you.
reviews.pros: Love SeekOut's mission empowering great companies and great people to grow together. The vision and execution is great and everyone, across functions, comes together to ensure that customers are being successful. Personally, one of the most compelling reason to be here is the culture of positivity, transparency, collaboration (all-in all-together), diversity, and gratitude. It's energizing to come to work everyday.

reviews.cons: Being a start-up environment always has its cons if you are not used to it. But the support and managerial staff make it extremely easy to be a part of. Another con, is since it's a Washington based company, some benefit providers lack heavily for remote workers like myself.
reviews.pros: Unlimited PTO, amazing benefits for being a startup, company culture is top notch, everybody is welcoming and supportive, paternity leave, the list goes on. Couldn't ask for a better company to work for; and to think my last employer was put on the 'Best Place to Work' list.

reviews.cons: Leadership didn't listen to customer feedback and make adjustments quick enough, now everything is very reactive.
reviews.pros: Initially, a great company culture with opportunity for growth but it didn't properly scale or plan.

reviews.advice: Listen to your employees, accept feedback, and be willing to learn.
reviews.cons: What was a great company when I started, turned into a misguided mismanaged mess. I watched super productive and highly successful sales people get laid off for no reasonable explanation other than a reduction in staff. Only to find out positions were back filled with new reps. The lack of transparency is alarming. Morale is probably the lowest in the company’s history and no one in the company seems to feel like there is any real job security. Such a shame as it was great company and former leadership painted this picture of such a bright future, touted how successful they were with raising money, but proceeded with two layoffs this year. Never seen high performers at the top of the leaderboard get let go as they do at SeekOut. Just awful.
reviews.pros: Culture/People: Used to be great, however not anymore. Once the CPO left and many other leaders this year, the culture of gratitude and morale tanked.

reviews.cons: No cons at this time.
reviews.pros: I had a fantastic onboarding experience where I did not feel judged for my large stream of questions. SeekOut is a top-notch company filled with talented people. Every time I have questions, I always get the assistance I need. There is strong collaboration, fun culture here. cannot recommend it enough!

reviews.cons: It's hard to answer this as this has been one of the best experiences I have had in my 20-year-long career
reviews.pros: There was an instant sense of belongingness cultivated right from the time I ended up on the careers page to the time I was onboarded. The content was most relevant and the delivery was very well thought through. The HR team goes above and beyond to personalize the experience.
reviews.summary: The best candidate and onboarding experience in two decades

reviews.advice: Listen to your frontline leaders and hire a CRO that will actually speak to your reps before deciding which reps to cut. (aka those who make the most money which by default is the most skilled reps)
reviews.cons: Leadership doesn't listen to frontline employees, the product has a lot of barriers to entry and leadership doesn't listen to feedback from users to make the tool easier to use. They have gone through 2 layoffs this year and they don't pay out commission underneath anything below 50% (first I have heard of but I'm sure it happens). Upper leadership doesn't really provide constructive feedback for the team to learn and grow. Decent launch pad for something else, but I wouldn't bet that you will succeed very well here in with the leadership in play right now. This org preaches diversity and care for employees but when the rubber hits the road...action says otherwise.
reviews.pros: Most of the people were amazing to work with. Flexible

reviews.cons: I can't think of any

reviews.pros: Great company, great culture when it was smaller
reviews.summary: It was great at a point

reviews.cons:
High Management Turnover: There's a noticeable pattern of senior managers joining with great enthusiasm, to leave shortly afterward, often citing personal reasons, only to reappear at another company within a few months.
Lack of Product Strategy: the product strategy is severely lacking. Numerous bugs remain unresolved because the engineering team is stretched to its limits.
GTM Strategy is practically non-existent, further hampering the success.
Recently, the company went through a second round of reductions in force, resulting in the loss of many talented individuals who were not fairly compensated upon their departure.
The company claims to prioritize a people-centric culture, with Anoop (CEO) often emphasizing this value. While he may genuinely believe in this vision, the reality is starkly different. Employees are treated poorly, and it’s clear that the company's actions do not align with its stated values.
Despite selling a product for internal mobility, the company fails to provide such opportunities for its own employees.
Questionable Diversity and Inclusion Practices: While the company boasts about its diversity and inclusion initiatives, it cannot claim true diversity by merely hiring women for traditionally female-occupied roles.
Due to these ongoing issues, I am actually actively seeking new job opportunities.
reviews.pros:
It was a great company about two years ago. 
There are still a lot of good people. 
Unlimited PTO!

reviews.advice: Check your unconscious biases about the cognitive inferiority of non-eng/prod employees. Pay more attention to front line CS and sales.  Use AI to understand customer concerns and address root causes.
reviews.cons: Head of the product of the future was emotionally abusive and despite causing much attrition and discord was left in role for far too long which resulted in many wondering if the company preferred friends over real talent. Head of legal and risk supremely duplicitous and eroded trust.
reviews.pros: Loved many of my colleagues and the customers we served. Lots of incredibly kind people.
reviews.summary: Trying but lacking vision, inclusion and performance management

reviews.advice:
* Focus, be accountable
* Invest for the long term
* Invest in people
* Address known problems
reviews.cons:
* Rough waters right now. Multiple rounds of layoffs and low morale. Lots of talented and good people have left.

* SeekOut when I joined was known for its people first culture. Less so now. People are undervalued and overworked.

* Leadership is reactionary. Priorities constantly shift. The focus is on short term wins instead of long term measured growth.

* Leadership does not take responsibility. Strategy and culture problems are getting in the way of our success.

* Leadership turn a blind eye to inappropriate behavior. There is harassment, bullying, and manipulation that is not addressed.

* Nearly all of the female senior leaders have left in recent years. This suggests a problem.

* Burn out is high. People are exhausted and demoralized from the shifts in priority, overpromising to customers, and expectations to do more with less.
reviews.pros:
* Smart and dedicated people
* Challenging work

reviews.cons:
Waters are rocky as the company tries to figure out how to right the ship after a year or two of downward trending revenue and market fit. 
Company is in the middle of a pretty significant cultural and organizational shift, as a result some are under water with work in the short term. The flip side of this is that we all have a real hand in designing the go-forward of the company and work expectations are fluid. Each employee is empowered to do what they feel is best for the long-term health of the company, but it’s a complicated time for us.
reviews.pros:
Have a significant hand in building something innovative. 
Work for some of the smartest and most empathetic leaders you’re likely to meet. 

I felt the need to emphasize this because I see a lot of brutal reviews after the most recent round of layoffs (totally understandable and I don’t mean to undermine their experiences, but I do want to provide some perspective for prospective employees). I am not a senior employee or even a manager of any kind, so I think I have a rather unbiased view. The leadership at SeekOut is in a very difficult spot; they expected the hyper-growth of 2021 to continue, over-hired for that scenario, and then were met with a dramatically changed market. Something had to change and this change has been painful. But I have nothing but the utmost respect for many of our senior leaders and know them to be good leaders and good people. The changes we’re going through are necessary, and though the future outlook is not clear, we have a very real chance of turning this company into something incredible.

Don’t come to SeekOut expecting a smooth ride to an imminent public offering, but do come to SeekOut expecting real ownership in your work and the chance to write the story of a promising company with a wonderful group of people. I have no regrets in joining SeekOut, and I’m genuinely optimistic for the future.
reviews.summary: Wonderful People, Huge Opportunity, but Complicated Time

reviews.cons: A bit unstable but that’s sort of expected with startups. We had multiple rounds of layoffs.

Leadership seems to keep blaming things on external factors, when the real problem is internal, such as not focusing on revenue driving activities.

reviews.pros: SeekOut is my first job after I graduated from college, and I couldn't be happier with this choice. SeekOut continues to lead with empathy and kindness - which makes me happy to wake up every morning to work! We truly stand by our values and constantly lead with gratitude.

reviews.advice: Invest in customer, partner and channel relationships to drive demand gen and advocacy.
reviews.cons: Hyper growth on team can be hard to keep up with.
reviews.pros: Strong product and support from executives through management and across all teams.

reviews.cons: Being a start-up environment always has its cons if you are not used to it. But the support and managerial staff make it extremely easy to be a part of. Another con, is since it's a Washington based company, some benefit providers lack heavily for remote workers like myself.
reviews.pros: Unlimited PTO, amazing benefits for being a startup, company culture is top notch, everybody is welcoming and supportive, paternity leave, the list goes on. Couldn't ask for a better company to work for; and to think my last employer was put on the 'Best Place to Work' list.

reviews.cons: N/A (no cons for me)
reviews.pros: - Very warm, supportive, inclusive culture - Lots of opportunities to learn and grow - Very kind and nice manager - Nice compensation and perks

reviews.advice: Practice what you preach.
reviews.cons: The work and personal life balance at SeekOut is significantly imbalanced, with little regard for employees' personal time. SeekOut appears to prioritize engineering-led growth, with the product roadmap often determined by anecdotes from random customers or mimicking competitor actions. Meetings and conversations with the CEO at SeekOut can be challenging, as bullying behaviors are often displayed. SeekOut's focus appears to be scattered due to a "do everything" mentality, resulting in a lack of direction. SeekOut does not consistently utilize its own product when searching for new hires, which may indicate a lack of faith in the effectiveness of their own platform. SeekOut's intense commitment to a new product is questionable, as there seems to be minimal interest from potential buyers.
reviews.pros: Decent compensation. Good mission and focus on diversity.

reviews.advice: Don’t be afraid to have a stance and strategy that align, practice the transparency and openness that you often vocalize
reviews.cons: No clear direction and alignment on where the company or product is going. Priorities shift constantly and leadership does not seem to all be on the same page, in some cases lacking the ability to be open minded to different perspectives or pushback. Strategy and identity seem to be unclear from the top down.
reviews.pros: Decent compensation and benefits offered, nice people and fast paced

reviews.cons: No solid sales structure through org.
reviews.pros: No micromanagement and freedom to do job.

reviews.cons: Highly reactive environment, which can be good with some product decisions. Overall felt the company was stretched to thin with heavy emphasis on agility
reviews.pros: Great people and community within the organization. Surrounded by supportive and genuinely kind people. Additionally, the product is great. It provides a great tool to recruiters and hiring teams.

reviews.cons: None so far and I don't expect any.
reviews.pros: What a great interview and onboarding process. I have felt welcome along the way. I am grateful for people who came in during their off time to accommodate for my schedule and interview process.
reviews.summary: All I can think of is WOW!

reviews.advice: Listen to your frontline leaders and hire a CRO that will actually speak to your reps before deciding which reps to cut. (aka those who make the most money which by default is the most skilled reps)
reviews.cons: Leadership doesn't listen to frontline employees, the product has a lot of barriers to entry and leadership doesn't listen to feedback from users to make the tool easier to use. They have gone through 2 layoffs this year and they don't pay out commission underneath anything below 50% (first I have heard of but I'm sure it happens). Upper leadership doesn't really provide constructive feedback for the team to learn and grow. Decent launch pad for something else, but I wouldn't bet that you will succeed very well here in with the leadership in play right now. This org preaches diversity and care for employees but when the rubber hits the road...action says otherwise.
reviews.pros: Most of the people were amazing to work with. Flexible

reviews.advice: Address Employee Morale Act on Feedback Financial Stewardship Stop laying off top sales talent
reviews.cons: The absence of effective leadership from the CEO to lower levels is evident, resulting in a company grappling with operational deficiencies, unaddressed feedback, and two rounds of layoffs, all of which have severely dampened employee morale
reviews.pros: Started off great but went downhill quickly

reviews.cons: There can be more focus on keeping up with the competition versus improving parts of the core product to be the best they possibly can.
reviews.pros: Collaborative culture. Innovative environment. Results driven.

reviews.cons: Nothing immediate comes to mind
reviews.pros: I am very impressed with the quality of the team and the culture of gratitude that has been created. I feel fortunate to work with this group and am excited about the future!

reviews.cons: Constant work and meetings. Long hours
reviews.pros: Inclusive, fun , generous, diverse, all ages

reviews.advice: Listen to your employees, accept feedback, and be willing to learn.
reviews.cons: What was a great company when I started, turned into a misguided mismanaged mess. I watched super productive and highly successful sales people get laid off for no reasonable explanation other than a reduction in staff. Only to find out positions were back filled with new reps. The lack of transparency is alarming. Morale is probably the lowest in the company’s history and no one in the company seems to feel like there is any real job security. Such a shame as it was great company and former leadership painted this picture of such a bright future, touted how successful they were with raising money, but proceeded with two layoffs this year. Never seen high performers at the top of the leaderboard get let go as they do at SeekOut. Just awful.
reviews.pros: Culture/People: Used to be great, however not anymore. Once the CPO left and many other leaders this year, the culture of gratitude and morale tanked.

reviews.cons: Compensation adjustments tied to Company performance over team/personal performance

reviews.advice: Sell

reviews.pros: There was an instant sense of belongingness cultivated right from the time I ended up on the careers page to the time I was onboarded. The content was most relevant and the delivery was very well thought through. The HR team goes above and beyond to personalize the experience.
reviews.summary: The best candidate and onboarding experience in two decades

reviews.cons: I can't think of any
reviews.pros: The organization is growing. Tons of opportunity to learn. No micromanaging and everyone are down to earth. Everyone tries to help you regardless of which department you are from.

reviews.advice: Do what you are supposed to do as leaders and humans and actually protect the wellbeing of the people who are working to make you rich.
reviews.cons: A few individuals are the very definition of toxic and they hold the rest of the company in a constant swirl of anxiety, frustration, and feeling gaslighted. On the surface leadership espouses how much they care about culture and gratitude, but under the covers they protect and even participate in belittling, undermining, disrespecting, and cutthroat behaviors. They believe they are better than everyone else and never look in the mirror at the destruction and pain they are wreaking in almost all areas of the company. The insidious part is that they hide their behavior behind the excuse of having “high standards” and every attempt to call attention to their behavior is twisted into blaming those that speak up. All who try to change things for the better are systematically discredited and discarded. You’ll learn about the long history of victims that have gone through this when you join. When you look at the quality of the product you’ll understand that they are actually not competent at leading a team that can build a great product or support great sales and CS teams. Overall this place could be great. They operate in an interesting product space and have some great people working there, but the fact that leadership not only fails to protect its employees from the toxicity, but protects and rewards it, is unacceptable. Everyone should avoid this place unless looking for an immersive lesson in workplace toxicity.
reviews.pros: Truly kind and talented people throughout the company.
reviews.summary: The toxic culture you read about in books

reviews.cons:
High Management Turnover: There's a noticeable pattern of senior managers joining with great enthusiasm, to leave shortly afterward, often citing personal reasons, only to reappear at another company within a few months.
Lack of Product Strategy: the product strategy is severely lacking. Numerous bugs remain unresolved because the engineering team is stretched to its limits.
GTM Strategy is practically non-existent, further hampering the success.
Recently, the company went through a second round of reductions in force, resulting in the loss of many talented individuals who were not fairly compensated upon their departure.
The company claims to prioritize a people-centric culture, with Anoop (CEO) often emphasizing this value. While he may genuinely believe in this vision, the reality is starkly different. Employees are treated poorly, and it’s clear that the company's actions do not align with its stated values.
Despite selling a product for internal mobility, the company fails to provide such opportunities for its own employees.
Questionable Diversity and Inclusion Practices: While the company boasts about its diversity and inclusion initiatives, it cannot claim true diversity by merely hiring women for traditionally female-occupied roles.
Due to these ongoing issues, I am actually actively seeking new job opportunities.
reviews.pros:
It was a great company about two years ago. 
There are still a lot of good people. 
Unlimited PTO!

reviews.cons:
SeekOut was by far the most toxic, soul-sucking, and dysfunctional organization I have ever worked for. All of the issues can be traced back to top-level leadership that lacks any semblance of strategy, accountability, and basic humanity. Bullying behavior from the CEO and leaders in his inner circle were not only allowed, but rewarded with promotions. Incompetent VPs micromanaged every detail of downstream teams, severely hindering autonomy and productivity.

Backstabbing, demeaning language, and blaming others were a common occurrence. Every team across the organization was aware of the problems, but leadership instilled a culture of fear and retaliation. Well-meaning employees who surfaced concerns were ignored and/or punished with public humiliation, more work, or simply fired.

Leadership's definition of 'product strategy' was copying our competitors, or straight up lying to customers about what the product does to close a sale, leaving other teams in a horrible position to scramble and try and deliver on impossible promises. Gaslighting happened at every level, with priorities constantly changing, and lower-level employees blamed for the misdirection. 

The result of this impossibly toxic culture? Dissatisfied customers, multiple quarters of missed growth targets, constant turnover of high-performing employees, and 3 major layoffs in less than 1.5yrs. This company is literally burning to the ground, and the leaders have nobody to blame but themselves. But it's highly unlikely that group of cowards are brave enough to look in the mirror and take any accountability.
reviews.pros: Nice people at lower levels (although many were axed in the latest round of layoffs). Also, they have a nice espresso machine in the office.

reviews.cons: Since the first round of layoffs in 2023, it has been nothing but down hill from there, following with 2 additional rounds of layoffs. The Leadership team seems to think that layoffs will solve their problems and extend their runway, however all it is a short term solution to an unidentified long term problem. Leadership seems to keep blaming things on external factors, when the real problem is internal, such as not focusing on revenue driving activities.
reviews.pros:
Great people on the sales team. 
Supportive culture on the team level 
Flexible work schedule

reviews.cons: No cons at this time.
reviews.pros: I had a fantastic onboarding experience where I did not feel judged for my large stream of questions. SeekOut is a top-notch company filled with talented people. Every time I have questions, I always get the assistance I need. There is strong collaboration, fun culture here. cannot recommend it enough!

reviews.cons:
Waters are rocky as the company tries to figure out how to right the ship after a year or two of downward trending revenue and market fit. 
Company is in the middle of a pretty significant cultural and organizational shift, as a result some are under water with work in the short term. The flip side of this is that we all have a real hand in designing the go-forward of the company and work expectations are fluid. Each employee is empowered to do what they feel is best for the long-term health of the company, but it’s a complicated time for us.
reviews.pros:
Have a significant hand in building something innovative. 
Work for some of the smartest and most empathetic leaders you’re likely to meet. 

I felt the need to emphasize this because I see a lot of brutal reviews after the most recent round of layoffs (totally understandable and I don’t mean to undermine their experiences, but I do want to provide some perspective for prospective employees). I am not a senior employee or even a manager of any kind, so I think I have a rather unbiased view. The leadership at SeekOut is in a very difficult spot; they expected the hyper-growth of 2021 to continue, over-hired for that scenario, and then were met with a dramatically changed market. Something had to change and this change has been painful. But I have nothing but the utmost respect for many of our senior leaders and know them to be good leaders and good people. The changes we’re going through are necessary, and though the future outlook is not clear, we have a very real chance of turning this company into something incredible.

Don’t come to SeekOut expecting a smooth ride to an imminent public offering, but do come to SeekOut expecting real ownership in your work and the chance to write the story of a promising company with a wonderful group of people. I have no regrets in joining SeekOut, and I’m genuinely optimistic for the future.
reviews.summary: Wonderful People, Huge Opportunity, but Complicated Time

reviews.cons:
•Blame culture.
•Senior leadership takes no accountability for poor decision-making.
•Lack of respect for expertise.

Morale is at an all-time low, with employees feeling genuinely betrayed by senior leadership. The company recently went through another round of layoffs, the second within a year. Shockingly, some positions that were eliminated are now being actively recruited for again, underscoring the poor decision-making at the top. Leadership believes rehiring people for less money is a viable strategy. They consistently ignore feedback and it seems inevitable that the company will face more serious issues soon.
reviews.pros: Highly skilled and talented colleagues
reviews.summary: Talented team undermined by poor leadership

reviews.advice:
* Focus, be accountable
* Invest for the long term
* Invest in people
* Address known problems
reviews.cons:
* Rough waters right now. Multiple rounds of layoffs and low morale. Lots of talented and good people have left.

* SeekOut when I joined was known for its people first culture. Less so now. People are undervalued and overworked.

* Leadership is reactionary. Priorities constantly shift. The focus is on short term wins instead of long term measured growth.

* Leadership does not take responsibility. Strategy and culture problems are getting in the way of our success.

* Leadership turn a blind eye to inappropriate behavior. There is harassment, bullying, and manipulation that is not addressed.

* Nearly all of the female senior leaders have left in recent years. This suggests a problem.

* Burn out is high. People are exhausted and demoralized from the shifts in priority, overpromising to customers, and expectations to do more with less.
reviews.pros:

* Challenging work

reviews.cons: Leadership didn't listen to customer feedback and make adjustments quick enough, now everything is very reactive.
reviews.pros: Initially, a great company culture with opportunity for growth but it didn't properly scale or plan.

reviews.pros: They will make you feel good

reviews.cons: No cons so far - I'm just started.
reviews.pros:
Interview: Company has really good and fast interview process. Everyone was friendly and generally nobody want you to push to fail. 

Office: Company has nice office in Downtown Bellevue and provide all nice facilities (small gym, parking), paid lunches, rest and game room, kitchen and etc. Office are good, quite and cozy.

reviews.cons: Leadership can’t speak to how the product is improving customer’s experience and only focused on closing deals
reviews.pros: Great people and a promising product

reviews.cons: Can't think of one for now...
reviews.pros: Great engineers. Good office location with lots of perks. Terrific co-workers on my team.
reviews.summary: Brand new, glad to be here

reviews.cons: Product updates are slow to launch
reviews.pros: Feel very supported and collaborative

reviews.cons: No cell phone stipend or reimbursement for new device.
reviews.pros: Great group of people that are kind and welcoming! Helpful and a ton of great resources.

reviews.advice: Keep doing what you're doing—but never lose that spark that makes SeekOut feel like the rarest thing in tech: a company that leads with its soul. The way you approach interviews is a masterclass in treating people like, well… people. Don’t ever change that.
reviews.cons: If you’re looking for a place to clock in, zone out, and coast through the day, this probably isn’t it. SeekOut attracts people who care—maybe a little too much—and that level of passion can be intense if you’re not wired the same way. But that’s also what makes it great.
reviews.pros:
The interview process at SeekOut was what every candidate hopes for but rarely finds—transparent, thoughtful, and human. From start to finish, I felt genuinely seen, heard, and valued. Conversations were real—not robotic. Everyone I spoke with approached the process with warmth, intellect, and a shared sense of purpose. They weren’t just checking boxes—they were making sure it was the right fit, for both sides.

Rejoining SeekOut felt less like taking a job and more like returning to a place where I’ve always belonged. The culture? Still electric. The mission? Even more relevant. The people? Absolute rockstars.
reviews.summary: Like Coming Home to the Coolest House on the Block

reviews.advice: Your VP of Product is holding you back.
reviews.cons: Outside of the design team, specifically among upper management, it was "my way or the highway." Any dissension, no matter how researched, data-proven, or user-studied was met with "but that's not how I would use it." Management's lack of understanding of product development and design is a large hindrance on the company.
reviews.pros: Within the design team, when it existed, there was encouragement and collaboration and advocation for the users. Experience and research was well utilized, and feedback was constructive and acted on appropriately. The design team, in partnership with engineering, was as ideal as it could be.

glassdoor_result.summary_markdown:
# Employee Sentiments

## Reasons Employees Like Working at SeekOut

### Positive Company Culture
- "The whole SeekOut team supports one another -- especially with the pandemic, it's important to know your teammates will help you." [(Software Engineer, Glassdoor, 2020-12-06)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW39150537.htm)
- "SeekOut has put the human element first and it shines through in every interaction!" [(Senior Recruiter, Glassdoor, 2022-08-12)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW67855253.htm)
- "I feel fortunate to work with this group and am excited about the future!" [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2023-11-20)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW81974582.htm)

### Strong Leadership
- "The management team is smart, driven, and experienced enough to run the company effectively." [(Software Engineer, Glassdoor, 2020-12-06)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW39150537.htm)
- "Leadership has incredible depth of previous experience...and they draw from it every day." [(Strategic Account Executive, Glassdoor, 2021-01-12)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW40541382.htm)

### Opportunities for Growth
- "Everyone has an opportunity to do significant meaningful work." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2021-01-04)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW40077898.htm)
- "There are tons of opportunities to learn and grow." [(Software Engineer, Glassdoor, 2023-02-06)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW73375253.htm)

### Benefits
- "Unlimited PTO, amazing benefits for being a startup, company culture is top notch." [(Integration Consultant, Glassdoor, 2023-01-13)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW72602407.htm)
- "Great compensation, work is interesting and challenging." [(Software Engineer, Glassdoor, 2024-09-11)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW90932903.htm)

## Reasons Employees Dislike Working at SeekOut

### Leadership Issues
- "The absence of effective leadership from the CEO to lower levels is evident." [(Account Executive, Glassdoor, 2023-10-12)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW80901300.htm)
- "Senior leadership takes no accountability for poor decision-making." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2024-06-19)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW88407890.htm)

### Work-Life Balance
- "The work and personal life balance at SeekOut is significantly imbalanced." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2023-03-30)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW75054542.htm)
- "Burn out is high. People are exhausted and demoralized from the shifts in priority." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2024-07-02)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW88785950.htm)

### Company Direction and Strategy
- "No clear direction and alignment on where the company or product is going." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2023-05-05)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW76159254.htm)
- "Leadership doesn't listen to frontline employees." [(Senior Account Manager, Glassdoor, 2023-09-28)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW80506906.htm)

## Key Events or Changes in the Company
- "We made it through 2020 with no layoffs and strong growth." [(Director of Customer Success, Glassdoor, 2020-12-29)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW39896284.htm)
- "The company has doubled in size over the last 12 months." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2022-10-09)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW69935756.htm)

## Specific Details About Benefits
- "The company has learning and wellness benefits which are great." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2021-01-04)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW40077898.htm)
- "Strong product and support from executives through management and across all teams." [(Enterprise Account Executive, Glassdoor, 2022-12-14)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW71860841.htm)

## Common Positive Sentiments
- "Great company - terrific product, fun team, strong management." [(Software Engineer, Glassdoor, 2020-12-06)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW39150537.htm)
- "Fantastic culture." [(Senior Recruiter, Glassdoor, 2022-08-12)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW67855253.htm)

## Common Negative Sentiments
- "Toxic culture." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2024-05-15)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW87306135.htm)
- "High management turnover." [(Customer Success Manager (CSM), Glassdoor, 2024-05-17)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-SeekOut-RVW87370210.htm)
